title: fixing possible safety issue with altitude

conversation.author: catch-twenty-two
conversation.body: Ignoring requested altitude from target for now.

conversation.author: pickledgator
conversation.body: Descend was unimplemented in navigator, and thus had no effect when the navigation state was changed. Utilized same land helper. Downstream logic in pos_control and commander successfully ignore position data that is applied in the setpoint message. Tested in gazebo for multi-rotors.

issue_comments.author: julianoes
issue_comments.body: Nice catch. How did you find this, in which scenario did the bug show up?

issue_comments.author: pickledgator
issue_comments.body: To support development, I needed a way to trigger a failsafe landing without xy position control, even when position data is available in the filter (eg., bad VO). Descend nav state provides the control mechanism that I desired, and I piped an RC channel to a new failsafe main state to trigger the Descend.

issue_comments.author: mhkabir
issue_comments.body: @pickledgator Sounds nice! Would you be able to send in a PR with the rest of your changes ? It would be very useful for others using VO too :)

I'm no filmmaker... which is very apparent from this video, it contains:

1) Me walking with follow me mode activated.
2) My mother who I recruited to help me, walking with follow me mode activated (all the rest of my friends are at work on weekday mornings, imagine that! :) )
3) Me riding my Xooter Scooter that I use to get around San Francisco, with follow me activated. At this point I was actually brave enough to set the RC down so I had no safety net (if anything were to go wrong) and let my code do it's work....

There was a slight wind blowing probably around 7-10 mph the frame type is a DJI style 330.

title: VTOL_TAKEOFF, VTOL_LAND commands and VT_FORCE_VTOL param

conversation.author: sanderux
conversation.body:
support for MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_TAKEOFF and MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_LAND 
Also implement VT_FORCE_VTOL to force land as VTOL
replaces https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/pull/3720

Fixes #3492
Fixes #3712

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body:
@AndreasAntener I cleaned up the mission code, sanitized the functionality, improved back transition behavior, fixed alignment and implemented force_vtol procedure.
SITL tested all reasonable scenarios and regression tested on the old procedure (takeoff -> trans -> wp -> trans -> land).

I'm especially happy with the back transition improvement, we could see if the basis could change from time to velocity but for now this seems to be a big improvement.

I will test fly this tree soon but i think it is ready to rebase and merge as i see no possible regression and it only implements previously unsupported functionality.

Somehow this tagged along through a submodule init and causes travis to fail: https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/pull/4055/files#diff-d62dbab64e619e0e5926b64585204efdR1
I think that should be resolved by rebasing but i'm not sure.

/cc @LorenzMeier @tumbili

issue_comments.author: AndreasAntener
issue_comments.body: @sanderux Could you rebase and squash the development commits? There are also wrong indentations in the mission code it seems

issue_comments.author: LorenzMeier
issue_comments.body: @AndreasAntener @sanderux There is a 15 character limit on parameter length, what I proposed works, what you proposed doesn't.

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body: @LorenzMeier I tested VT_NAV_FORCE_VTL as param and that works. Do you want me to change it?

issue_comments.author: LorenzMeier
issue_comments.body: 16 is the hard limit without NUL-termination. It should work, but you can get yourself into corner cases in downstream implementations. I suggest to use VT_NAV_FORCE_VT instead.

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body: ready to merge

issue_comments.author: LorenzMeier
issue_comments.body: Is this state SITL and outdoor tested? I think it should be, as the changes are significant.

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body: Sitl is tested, outdoor tomorrow

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body:
Outdoor tested in quite strong wind. 
http://logs.uaventure.com/view/JRG4pRghKoV3RK8eS3o75k#AS_Yaw_PLOT

1 There was a sudden unintended yaw action when front transition started, see yaw setpoint change
2 Very smooth back transition but quite a high time and in strong winds it drifts a lot 
3 During lading it weathervaned and got lift from it's wings, it therefor acted up a little.

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body:
Here is a second log:
http://logs.uaventure.com/view/PJYu2ARidpuQyFsX9qxdKm

The yaw setpoint issue is consistent
The airspeed sensor for the quadranger acted up here (turned out to be the radio telem being too close)

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body: This should fix the yaw issue during transition

issue_comments.author: AndreasAntener
issue_comments.body: @sanderux before I forget, mission item reached: one reason to not wait on the transition to be finished is that the position controller won't know the next waypoint and therefore cannot control the position during the transition in case we later implement this. haven't thought about it in detail though.

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body:
the advantage of this command is that the user can point the vehicle into the wind. It is basically the autonomous equivlant of flicking the aux1 switch.

For position control it should hold altitude and heading until ttansition has completed or timeout occurs.

issue_comments.author: AndreasAntener
issue_comments.body:
Sure but it's changing the behaviour in general, also for the separate transitions (not part of VTOL tko/lnd). What we talked about yesterday, if we want the FW position controller to guide it through blending, it needs to know the next waypoint. If it doesn't get the actual next mission waypoint, we need to generate a temporary waypoint that lies in the direction of the target transition heading. Another option would be to look at the "next" waypoint in the triplet, which contains the next position during the transition. Ok, I think we have 2 good options here so it's fine.

Note: simply holding heading and attitude is not going to work, it will drift off path.

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body: Yes your right, i think a temp waypoint would be a good idea.

issue_comments.author: LorenzMeier
issue_comments.body: Waiting for conclusive test flights to merge this.

issue_comments.author: AndreasAntener
issue_comments.body: I did a sitl test to check on the Z velocity issue that i see in your log from #4079: The position controller still sees a takeoff type setpoint during the transition. Needs to be reset, should be a small fix.

issue_comments.author: sanderux
issue_comments.body: @AndreasAntener do you agree on the location of setting the setpoint type?

title: reset mission after vehicle was in mission and then disarms

conversation.author: AndreasAntener
conversation.body:
Fixes #3978 , SITL tested
Please review

Note: I had the reset code in commander first but that didn't feel right so I moved it to mission. There might be a better way to trigger the reset instead via the `offboard_mission` topic.

issue_comments.author: LorenzMeier
issue_comments.body: Changes / architecture looks good.

issue_comments.author: LorenzMeier
issue_comments.body: I commented on this. I think it needs to be done solely in the navigator without intervention from the commander.

issue_comments.author: AndreasAntener
issue_comments.body: @LorenzMeier makes sense, will fix this

issue_comments.author: AndreasAntener
issue_comments.body: Updated, SITL tested.

issue_comments.author: LorenzMeier
issue_comments.body: Looked good, sane and safe, so I applied it to master, thanks!

review_comments.author: LorenzMeier
review_comments.body: Why is this logic in the commander after all? Can't the navigator just do this by itself, since it knows the current flight mode?

review_comments.author: LorenzMeier
review_comments.body: This introduces a race with the mavlink app, which also publishes this topic. If we publish something from the commander, it would need to be done on a different topic.

review_comments.author: LorenzMeier
review_comments.body: Would prefer to trigger this on a vehicle status change with state == mission and disarmed.

issue_comments.author: dagar
issue_comments.body:
@LorenzMeier @DonLakeFlyer ready for review please

Current @unit usage

```
  4  * @unit 1/s
  1  * @unit A
  1  * @unit bit/s
 44  * @unit boolean
 40  * @unit deg
  4  * @unit deg * 1e7
 19  * @unit deg/s
 54  * @unit enum
  1  * @unit Gauss
  1  * @unit Gauss/s
  1  * @unit hPa
  5  * @unit Hz
  1  * @unit kg
  3  * @unit kg*m^2
 47  * @unit m
  1  * @unit m^2
  1  * @unit mA
  1  * @unit min
  1  * @unit m/m
 12  * @unit ms
  1  * @unit m-s
 35  * @unit m/s
  2  * @unit (m/s)-s
 10  * @unit m/s/s
  1  * @unit (m/s/s)-s
  1  * @unit rad
  8  * @unit rad/s
 26  * @unit s
  7  * @unit SD
 66  * @unit us
  3  * @unit V
  1  * @unit W
```
